text: :bulb: Add a <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/HubSpot-Ideas/Create-a-NOT-MATCHES-REGEX-module-operator/idi-p/381653|NOT_MATCHES_REGEX visibility operator to modules>. Because of <https://github.com/google/re2/wiki/Syntax|re2>’s lack of support for negative look ahead, it is not possible to show a module field on the condition that it doesn’t match a regex. It is not currently possible to hide a field if it contains “<http://facebook.com|facebook.com>”, for instance.

I'd love to see some type of image size validation in modules. One pain point of client's managing sites is getting them to upload the correct size images. Something like what ACF offers with image size validation to ensure they add images that are size properly would be awesome. The resize_image_url function only gets us half way since cropping isn't any option. If cropping was and option within the resize_image_url function, that would be a solution as well.
in Addition to that a small warning message that lets the user know that  having large images has a pretty strong negative SEO  impact would also help.
